result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William D Nellem Jr

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 25, 2023 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Pre-trial conference on October 28, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant William D Nellem Jr in court.  Attorney Catherine Dorl for Crystal A Vera in court for William D Nellem Jr.  Attorney Tessa Lewandowski in court for State of Wisconsin. Witness MPD PO Michael Weibamann, duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by ADA Lewandowski. Venue established. Witness identification. Cross Exam by Atty Dorl. Redirect exam by ADA Lewandowski. Witness excused at 11:41 am. State moves for bind over, waived argument, reserve rebuttal. Defn objected to bind over. Argument by Atty Dorl. CT found PC this defn committed a felony and bound over to branch 12.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with BAL.
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 12

3:11 PM Defendant William D Nellem Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Adam Matthias Welch in court for William D Nellem Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
